body:
Hi guys,

I just tried installing ParaView with osmesa-support with a simple `spack install paraview+osmesa` on a cluster where I have no sudo-access. git and a gcc-compiler are in PATH and all of the dependencies build smoothly. During the CMake-phase of the ParaView-module however, I get an error which essentially comes down to the fact that the osmesa-library is missing. I attached the (renamed) spack-build.out of the ParaView-stage. Is it intended behaviour that I would have to build that library myself and then (somehow) link against it or provide a path? I would love to avoid having to build it myself. Thanks in advance!

Regards,

Mathias



Attachment - ParaView stage output:
[spack-build.out.txt](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/files/969788/spack-build.out.txt)
title: ParaView with osmesa support
